definitions: To introduce or incorporate small particles or a granular substance into something.
To apply a texture or visual effect that resembles the irregular pattern of natural grain, often in photography or digital imaging.
To contribute or include a small, often undesirable, element or quality to something.
examples: Add grain to the mixture slowly.
The photographer decided to add grain to the image for a vintage look.
His comments seemed to add grain to the already tense discussion.
